content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 5 column table, with 2 rows of data. The heading for column 1 is "x." The heading for column 2 is "f of x." The heading for column 3 is "f prime of x." The heading for column 4 is "g of x." The heading for column 5 is "g prime of x." The data in the table are as follows. Row 1. x is 1. f of x is 2. f prime of x is negative 4. g of x is negative 5. g prime of x is 3. Row 2. x is 2. f of x is negative 3. f prime of x is 1. g of x is 8. g prime of x is 4." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the differentiable functions <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and their derivatives at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, f of x, times g of x, plus 2 times g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="h prime of 1, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
